email:
Here's an email to UCL Admissions:

Subject: Application Query for Computer Science Program - Lewis Smith

Dear UCL Admissions Team,

I hope this email finds you well. My name is Lewis Smith and I am writing regarding my undergraduate application to the Computer Science program at University College London (UCL). As a local student, I am excited about the prospect of studying in one of the world's top institutions for computer science.

I was informed that my application is currently in a "gathered field". Could you please clarify what this means? Is it simply a matter of awaiting further review or are there additional steps that need to be completed before my application can proceed?

Additionally, I would appreciate some guidance on when I can expect to receive a decision regarding my fee status. As a UK student, I believe I am eligible for home fees, but I want to confirm this with your team.

Lastly, could you please let me know if there are any additional documents or information that I need to submit in support of my application? Have all relevant materials been received and processed?

I would be grateful if you could provide me with some insight into the current status of my application. Your assistance will help alleviate any uncertainty, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

Lewis Smith

questions.question: I've been told my application is in a gathered field, what does this mean?
questions.answer: A 'gathered field' approach allows UCL to assess all applications in the same fair and consistent manner, whether they are received in October or January. This means UCL will wait until they have enough comparable applications to make a final decision.

questions.question: When can I expect to receive a decision on my fee status?
questions.answer: UCL aims to provide the outcome of your fee status assessment before you need to make your Firm and Insurance decisions. However, if additional information is required, UCL may email you a Fee Status Questionnaire to complete.

questions.question: Do I need to send any additional documents or information in support of my application?
questions.answer: UCL will request any missing information required to support an application. Do not send information that has not been requested. If additional documents are needed, UCL will contact you by email and ask you to upload them securely to Portico.

prompt:
Your name is Lewis Smith and you are applying for a undergraduate program in Computer Science at UCL.
      You are a local student that is interested in the program.
      
      Write an email to UCL admissions asking the following questions:
 
      I've been told my application is in a gathered field, what does this mean? 
 When can I expect to receive a decision on my fee status? 
 Do I need to send any additional documents or information in support of my application?
